content.description: Route wanders to climbers right, climbing around a small beech tree, then up to top out or lower off top rope anchor.
content.protection: approximately 50' of rope for top rope anchor from medium size beech tree about 15' back from the edge of the rock.
content.location: Route starts approximately 15' to the right of right field.

content.description: Start from a ledge and follow a thin finger crack up to a left leaning hand crack.
content.protection: .4 to #1 Camelot and small to medium stoppers
content.location: The right of the two routes with a roof near the start.  15 feet right of Center Field.

content.description: Starting can be a bit tricky, but once on the shelf, it is pretty smooth going up. The route is covered in Lichen currently, so it does need to be cleaned. And this makes for a fun laid back top rope route. I would like to see bolts in the future as this would be a good "first Lead" route.
content.protection: No bolts yet, only natural top rope anchor.
content.location: On the "field side" of the Green Monster. There is a thorn bush at the bottom of the route.

content.description: Climb the wide crack with the large tree growing in the middle to a chossy thinner crack and top out.
content.location: Prominent crack in the cliff line in the rear of left field.

content.description: The small pocketed face that looks like a honeycomb on the far left side of the baseball field.
content.protection: X rated trad line, easily top roped
content.location: Heavily pocketed face right of Left Field

content.description: Climbs the wall close to the arete.  Route goes straight up the wall on crimps and curves to climbers left to anchors.
content.location: Walk to the cliff at the rear of the baseball field.  Follow the cliff to the left and around the corner. Route is the right bolted line of the three sport route, shares anchor with Cracker Jack.

content.description: On the Catacomb Wall, to the right of Willy Tea. Start at the crack and move to the right of the “catacomb area”. The object is to stay out of the “catacomb area” in the middle of the crag. Due to the direction you have to climb and where the Top Rope Anchor is, you will swing quite a bit if you fall.
content.location: Start at the center crack, where you start Willy Tea. Move to the right of the “catacomb area”. The object is to stay out of the “catacomb area” in the middle of the crag.

content.description: Follow crimps and sloping pockets straight up the sandstone face.  Shares bolted anchor with Green Monster.
content.location: Walk to the cliff at the back of the baseball field and follow the cliff to the left around an arete.  The route is the middle bolted route of the three.

content.description: The left of the two cracks with a roof to pull near the start
content.protection: .5 to #3 Camelot and medium to large stoppers
content.location: Walk to cliff at the rear of the baseball field, look for thin crack starting at a ledge under a small roof. Center of cliff line right of Honeycomb.

content.description: This is an excellent wall with lots of foot and handholds galore!  The wall is flat until you get to the brain (approx 30' up) then it gradually pitches out.
content.protection: No bolts yet.  Planning to add them soon.  Large tree at the top and a large boulder in front of it with a natural channel that's weathered out over the top of it to feed an anchor through (We made a tensionless anchor out of static rope).
content.location:
Two routes at the base of the wall.  The route on the right is called "Willy Tea" after Will Prater and his affinity for tea and the fact he's the first to climb it.  The left route is called "Brain Drain" after the feature that looks like a brain about 25' up.  From that point on you start getting drained of energy as you go.  Must be a mind game.... 

  Here's the breakdown: 

  1  WILLY TEA-  Work the crack until you get to the sandstone catacombs that make excellent hand and foot holds.  It takes a bit of strength and flex to move up.  Just above the catacombs, smear up to the next set and top out. 

  2. BRAIN DRAIN-  Work the crack up to the ledge we call the Short Porch.  You can easily stand here and plan your next move.  There are hand holds galore and you need to work your leg up onto the top of the "brain".  From there reach up and work the handholds that look like skulls and if you're persistent, top out!

content.description: Short, crimpy and slightly overhanging. Small roof crux right before anchor chains. Route arc's slightly to the climbers left.
content.location: At the cliff line in the rear of the baseball field walk to the left around a corner into the woods and see a wall with three bolted lines. Farthest left of the three sport routes on this wall.

content.description: Short cliff line in the outfield of the baseball field across from the dam.
